message.content: Let the other endpoint be $(x,y)$. We are given that the midpoint of the segment is $(2,9)$, so the midpoint's coordinates are the average of the x-coordinates and the average of the y-coordinates of the endpoint. Therefore, we have the system of equations  \[\begin{alignedat}{6} &&x &=& \frac{1}{2} (4)\\ &&y &=& \frac{1}{2} (3 + 2(9))\\ \\[-2.5ex] \implies\hspace{8pt}&& x &=& 2 \\ &&y &=& 10 \end{alignedat}\]The sum of the coordinates of the other endpoint is $x+y = 2+10 = \boxed{12}$.
